title: Chief Complaint
content: Soft tissue swelling in the hand

title: HPI Spencer
content: The patient reports noticing continued soft tissue swelling in her hand, particularly when more active. She had experienced hypersensitivity two weeks ago, which has significantly improved over the last week.

title: Musculoskeletal
content: Incision well healed, very minimal scar, no firmness to the scar. Excellent range of motion, full tight fist without pain, able to get hand flat on the table. There is a very slight extension lag, less than 5 degrees when compared to her baseline. Hyperextension, sensation decreased but improving on one of the digits.

title: Plan
content: Wean splint, advance activity and range of motion, return to clinic in 3 months for follow-up.
